Question: Which of the following options best summarizes your flight path to the gazebo next to the pond?

Choice:  
A. Start from above the red brick path in the courtyard, fly forward along the edge of the pond, reach the top of the pavilion by the pond, look down at the path, trees, pond, and pavilion by the water, and finally descend to the roof of the pavilion.  
B. Start near a small pond, fly over several residential buildings, cross a road, fly over an open space, descend to a parking lot, and finally stop above the pavilion.  
C. Start from a low altitude near the pavilion, rise to take pictures of the building, and end at a high altitude above the pond.  
D. Start from a distant high-rise building, avoid all intermediate structures and plants, reach directly to the pavilion, and end your journey above the pavilion roof.  
E. Start from a nearby city, fly over a major highway, then over the suburbs, and eventually arrive at the gazebo.

This matches the sequence of images showing an aerial view starting from a broader area and gradually focusing on the roof of the pavilion next to the pond.
